description: use as opportunity to look at spock framework vs mockito/powermock and groovytest
spock offers a more readable setup using behavioural type comments for each test and a style test format
it can be used with spring testing

it does offer some convenience/powerful features for although some of power only useful for groovy because it is offered for groovy it provides potential for use as overall framework for both groovy and java

as it does not offer some of flexibility of powermock and there doesn't seem to be powermock package groovy may need to be incorporated with say powermock's whitebox for easy use of reflection where if possible use as means of introducing actual unit tests not integration use for mint server side of harvesting as basic integration tests to build on already present for client

summary: analysis of where the editor should be
description: doco for tinymce downloaded version main docs api far more useful for configuration

for now choosing to put static version within usyd build that way can test against unchangeable and don't have to worry about potential problems with usyd firewall can test against later versions and then external javascript provider later

summary: add identifier field for creators primary contact supervisors and collaborators
description: currently there is no way to add a related party if they already have an identifier and are not referenced in mint or nla and soon add an identifier field to the creators primary contact supervisors and collaborators fields
these fields should be hidden when the lookup functionality is used
may not be suitable for all implementations especially if not public
understanding identifier not necessary just use portal path for record and a check whether this should be included
consider changes needed in form to allow selection of criteria for other can then use this information for generation rather than guessing
toggle rights type according to what is considered flip order so licence section sits above the rest

is work using duplicity and duply to make better use of file backups until sound architectural solution based on qcif policy in relying on depdendable tools rsynclib and gpg it produces a very configurable backup with a much smaller footprint
as it is unclear with arms whether a backup solution will be in place and that backups setup need to be quickly repeatable in case of problems on arms puppet deployment of this seems appropriate
for now it can be done with manual install of ssh and gpg keys

summary: work on scripts to help with transforming configuration changes in institutional builds
description: in version work has been done to allow users split the into smaller more manageable files
ideally we should provide a script that can tell the difference between the standard config and what is in the current institution's so that these can be split out as overrides

for now the script should be standalone if needed add whatever needed from fascinator to classpath under given a current uri for config the script should merge the together with current values to be preserved the resulting config should also be a single xml but with all the json config inside note once using any json tool the order will getting around this because of nature of maps put the script under support folder in
